duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop the IEP for each assigned student in coordination with, but not limited to, the IEP team, as well as other designated school personnel
Provide direct classroom instruction to students in accordance with each child's IEP and Elwyn's established curricula

Complete all documentation related to IEP development, progress monitoring, Re-evaluation Reports (RR), Behavioral Support Plans (BSP), and Extended School Year (ESY) Program, as required by PDE regulations and sending-district's requirements
Provide oversight, direction, support, and work assignments to all staff assigned to the classroom
Demonstrate flexibility in addressing daily situations involving children, parents, and classroom staff
Participate in all PDE-required/program-required professional development, including self-evaluative and program-established assessment tools and processes

education_certification.credential: Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE) Special Education certification; or eligibility for PDE emergency certification
